content.text: in toolkit.html, I want to make the size of those two cards the same.
The user wants to make the size of two cards the same in toolkit.html. Let me first read the toolkit.html file to see what cards they're referring to.

Looking at the toolkit.html file, I can see there are two cards in the grid-2 section:
1. O-RAM Card (lines 319-335)
2. AAA Card (lines 338-352)

The cards are wrapped in `<a>` tags and contain `.toolkit-card` divs. The issue is likely that the cards have different heights because they have different content - the O-RAM card has 5 bullet points while the AAA card has 3 bullet points.

To make the cards the same size, I should add `height: 100%` or `min-height: ...` to the `.toolkit-card` class, or add `display: flex; flex-direction: column;` to the toolkit-card and make the highlights area grow to fill the space.

A good solution would be to:
1. Make the `.toolkit-card` a flex container with `flex-direction: column`
2. Make the `.toolkit-highlights` flex grow to fill remaining space, or set a consistent `min-height` on the card

Let me make the cards have equal heights. The best approach is to set `display: flex; flex-direction: column;` on the card and then make the highlights section flex-grow, or simply set a minimum height. But looking at the content, the O-RAM card has more content, so setting min-height might not work well.

I think the best solution is to use flexbox on the card container with `flex-direction: column` and then make the content area grow to fill available space.

Good, I've made the toolkit-card a flex container with flex-direction: column and height: 100%. Now I need to make sure the content fills properly. I should also make the grid-2 use align-items: stretch to make the cards fill their grid cells, and make sure the highlights section grows to fill available space.

Actually, looking at this more carefully, I also need to ensure the grid items (the anchor tags) stretch to fill their height. Let me also update the grid-2 to have align-items: stretch.
Now I need to make sure the toolkit-highlights section grows to fill available space. I'll add flex-grow: 1 to .toolkit-highlights so it expands to take up any remaining space in the flex container.

Now I should also make sure the anchor tags that wrap the cards are stretching to fill the grid cell. Let me add a CSS rule for the grid items themselves. I'll add styling for the direct children of grid-2 (which are the anchor tags).

Perfect! Now the cards should be equal height. Let me verify what I've done:

1. Added `display: flex; flex-direction: column; height: 100%;` to `.toolkit-card` - This makes the card a flex container that takes up 100% of its available height.
2. Added `align-items: stretch;` to `.grid-2` - This makes grid items stretch to fill their height.
3. Added `.grid-2 > a { display: flex; }` - This makes the anchor tags (which are the grid items) flex containers, so they stretch to fill the grid cell and allow the card inside to stretch.
4. Added `flex-grow: 1;` to `.toolkit-highlights` - This makes the highlights section grow to fill remaining space in the card.

This should make both cards the same height, with the highlights section growing to fill any extra space. The user's task is complete.

Done. I've updated the CSS to make both cards equal height by:

1. Making `.toolkit-card` a flex column with `height: 100%`
2. Adding `align-items: stretch` to `.grid-2`
3. Making grid anchor tags display as flex
4. Adding `flex-grow: 1` to `.toolkit-highlights` so it expands to fill remaining space

diffs.patch:
@@ -3652,24 +3652,98 @@
 -top: 2rem;%0A
+      align-items: stretch;%0A    %7D%0A%0A    .grid-2 %3E a %7B%0A      display: flex;%0A
     %7D%0A%0A    .
@@ -4076,24 +4076,95 @@
 ow: hidden;%0A
+      display: flex;%0A      flex-direction: column;%0A      height: 100%25;%0A
     %7D%0A%0A    .
@@ -5063,32 +5063,52 @@
     z-index: 1;%0A
+      flex-grow: 1;%0A
     %7D%0A%0A    .tool

3N Consulting
Results. Delivered.
Home About Us Service Lines Careers Contact Us Meet Our Team Our Toolkit Disclaimers
Comprehensive Solutions

Service Lines

Consulting solutions tailored to your organization's unique needs and challenges.

Our Core Services

We deliver comprehensive consulting solutions across multiple service lines to help your organization thrive.

Organizational Redesign

We help organizations align their structure, people, and processes to drive resilience and agility. Our approach ensures your organization is positioned for sustainable growth and can respond effectively to market changes.

Strategy & Operations

From corporate strategy development to interim management and lean improvements, we help you minimize waste and maximize efficiency. Our strategic approach is grounded in operational reality and measurable outcomes.

Data Analytics

We develop frameworks and dashboards that uncover patterns, predict trends, and provide actionable insights. Our data-driven approach empowers you to make informed decisions that drive business results.

Digital Transformation

From legacy modernization to AI implementation, we help you navigate digital transformation while reducing the ~70% failure risk through proper alignment. Our holistic approach ensures technology and business strategy work together seamlessly.

Human Capital & Change Management

We strengthen employee engagement, accelerate adoption of new initiatives, and foster leadership with purpose. Our change management expertise ensures your organization successfully navigates transformation while maintaining productivity and culture.

Ready to Transform Your Organization?

Contact us to discuss how our service lines can help you achieve your business goals.

Get in Touch →

content.text: I want to replace the words "Service Lines" on the menu up top on all pages to "Services", as well as replace the words "Service Lines" with "Services" on services.html

The user wants to:
1. Replace "Service Lines" with "Services" in the menu on all pages
2. Replace "Service Lines" with "Services" on services.html

First, I need to find all HTML files and replace the text. Let me search for files that have "Service Lines" in them.

I should:
1. Find all HTML files that contain "Service Lines"
2. Replace them with "Services"

Let me start by finding all HTML files and searching for "Service Lines" in them.

content.output: No matches found for pattern "Service Lines" in path "." (filter: "**/*.html").

content.text: The grep didn't find "Service Lines" but the user said they want to replace it. Let me check the currently opened file (services.html) to see what's there, and also look at one of the pages to see the navigation.

content.output: No matches found for pattern "Service Line" in path "." (filter: "**/*.html").

content.text: Interesting, the grep isn't finding "Service Lines" or "Service Line". Let me read the services.html file to see what's actually there.
I can see "Service Lines" in line 5 of the title. Let me check index.html to see if the navigation has "Service Lines" there.
Let me search for where the navigation link is in index.html. I need to find the actual nav link that says "Service Lines".
Great! Found it. Now let me search for all occurrences in all HTML files to understand the scope of the replacement.

That's a lot of files to update. I need to replace "Service Lines" with "Services" in all these HTML files. Let me use a script to do this efficiently. I'll use sed to replace all occurrences in all HTML files at once.
Good! Now let me verify that the changes were made by checking a few files.
Perfect! The replacement was successful. Let me verify a couple more files to ensure the navigation was updated correctly.
Perfect! All the replacements have been made. The task is complete.
Done. Replaced "Service Lines" with "Services" across all HTML files, including the navigation menu and the services.html page itself.
